data_structures: integer variables for tracking min/max indices
algorithm_technique: Iterate through the array, maintaining the index of the minimum and maximum values encountered so far within the index difference window.
problem_summary_simple: Find two indices with a minimum index and value difference.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through nums, tracking min/max indices. Check conditions abs(i-j) >= indexDiff and abs(nums[i]-nums[j]) >= valueDiff.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by iterating once and keeping track of the minimum and maximum values seen so far within the required index difference.
The absolute value checks for differences can be simplified by considering the relative order of values and indices.
The solution efficiently checks potential pairs by maintaining the best candidates (min/max values) seen up to a certain point.
The loop structure ensures that for each potential `j`, we are comparing it against the best `i` candidates that satisfy the index difference.
